channel.title: CVE Feed for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache JSPWiki
channel.description: The latest CVEs for Apache Software Foundation -- Apache JSPWiki

item.title: CVE-2022-34158|2024-08-03T08:16:17.225Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20jspwiki
item.description: A carefully crafted invocation on the Image plugin could trigger an CSRF vulnerability on Apache JSPWiki before 2.11.3, which could allow a group privilege escalation of the attacker's account. Further examination of this issue established that it could also be used to modify the email associated with the attacked account, and then a reset password request from the login page.

item.title: CVE-2022-28730|2024-08-03T06:03:52.583Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20jspwiki
item.description: A carefully crafted request on AJAXPreview.jsp could trigger an XSS vulnerability on Apache JSPWiki, which could allow the attacker to execute javascript in the victim's browser and get some sensitive information about the victim. This vulnerability leverages CVE-2021-40369, where the Denounce plugin dangerously renders user-supplied URLs. Upon re-testing CVE-2021-40369, it appears that the patch was incomplete as it was still possible to insert malicious input via the Denounce plugin. Apache JSPWiki users should upgrade to 2.11.3 or later.

item.title: CVE-2022-27166|2024-08-03T05:18:39.251Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20jspwiki
item.description: A carefully crafted request on XHRHtml2Markup.jsp could trigger an XSS vulnerability on Apache JSPWiki up to and including 2.11.2, which could allow the attacker to execute javascript in the victim's browser and get some sensitive information about the victim.

item.title: CVE-2022-24947|2024-08-03T04:29:01.578Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20jspwiki
item.description: Apache JSPWiki user preferences form is vulnerable to CSRF attacks, which can lead to account takeover. Apache JSPWiki users should upgrade to 2.11.2 or later.

item.title: CVE-2022-28732|2024-08-03T06:03:52.589Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20jspwiki
item.description: A carefully crafted request on WeblogPlugin could trigger an XSS vulnerability on Apache JSPWiki, which could allow the attacker to execute javascript in the victim's browser and get some sensitive information about the victim. Apache JSPWiki users should upgrade to 2.11.3 or later.

item.title: CVE-2022-28731|2024-08-03T06:03:52.648Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20jspwiki
item.description: A carefully crafted request on UserPreferences.jsp could trigger an CSRF vulnerability on Apache JSPWiki before 2.11.3, which could allow the attacker to modify the email associated with the attacked account, and then a reset password request from the login page.

item.title: CVE-2022-24948|2024-08-03T04:29:01.128Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20jspwiki
item.description: A carefully crafted user preferences for submission could trigger an XSS vulnerability on Apache JSPWiki, related to the user preferences screen, which could allow the attacker to execute javascript in the victim's browser and get some sensitive information about the victim. Apache JSPWiki users should upgrade to 2.11.2 or later.

item.title: CVE-2024-27136|2024-06-24T13:27:32.693Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20jspwiki
item.description: XSS in Upload page in Apache JSPWiki 2.12.1 and priors allows the attacker to execute javascript in the victim's browser and get some sensitive information about the victim. Apache JSPWiki users should upgrade to 2.12.2 or later.

item.title: CVE-2024-27136|2024-06-24T07:44:30.732Z -- apache%20software%20foundation -- apache%20jspwiki
item.description: XSS in Upload page in Apache JSPWiki 2.12.1 and priors allows the attacker to execute javascript in the victim's browser and get some sensitive information about the victim. Apache JSPWiki users should upgrade to 2.12.2 or later.
